bibl.title: Letter from C.C. Williamson to Henry Rose Carter, November 27, 1923

div1.p: Williamson sends Carter a copy of an earlier letter. He does not want to burden Carter in any way.

div1.head: Letter from C.C. Williamson to Henry Rose Carter, November 27, 1923
div1.opener:
GEORGE E. VINCENT, PRESIDENT
EDWIN R. EMBREE, SECRETARY
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
L. G. MYERS, TREASURER
ROBERT H. KIRK, COMPTROLLER
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
F. F. RUSSELL, M. D., GENERAL DIRECTOR
CHINA MEDICAL BOARD
ROGER S. GREENE, DIRECTOR
DIVISION OF MEDICAL EDUCATION
RICHARD M. PEARCE, M. D., DIRECTOR
INFORMATION SERVICE
C. C. WILLIAMSON, Chief
November 27, 1923
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
We learn that you received the proof of our proposed pam-
phlet on the use of fish in mosquito control but failed to get the
letter which we mailed at the same time. Both letter and proof were
mailed to your Washington address. The proof, however, came back to
us with instructions to forward it to Baltimore, which we did. By
this time I assume you have the letter, but to make sure that you
understand precisely what we would like to have you do with the proof
I am enclosing a copy of the original letter.

Please do not let this burden you in any way. I hesitated
to send it to you at all, fearing that in doing so we would seem to
be making too large a demand on your time and strength.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, C. C. Williamson Dr. Henry R. Carter,
c/o Mrs. C. Goddard,
529 N. Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland
CCW:RCC - E
